name: Overseas Countries and Territories Association
goal:
The Association of the Overseas Countries and Territories of the European Union is a not-for-profit organisation that serves as a platform through which the Overseas Countries and Territories (OCTs) realize their common goals by working collectively through cooperation, policy dialogue, promotion of common positions and partnerships for the sustainable development of OCTs.

OCTA has the following objectives:
i. To provide a discussion forum for ideas and debates on subjects of shared interest.
ii. To work in the mutual interest of the members.
iii. To share specific information on subjects of shared interest benefiting all Overseas Countries and Territories of the European Union.
iv. To make recommendations when necessary to the governments of all OCTs and Member States of the European Union to which they belong concerning appropriate measures to be taken.
v. To develop effective working relations, as a group, with the institutions of the European Union, the group of African, Caribbean and Pacific countries and its secretariat and other relevant international, multilateral and regional organisations.
vi. To share successful experiences with members of the association in areas of shared interest.
vii. To defend the joint interests of the members and represent these interests to institutions of the European Union and in all areas listed in the OCT Decision
interests: Agriculture and Rural Development, Audiovisual and Media, Budget, Climate Action, Communication, Competition, Consumer Affairs, Culture, Customs, Development, Economic and Financial Affairs, Education, Employment and Social Affairs, Energy, Enlargement, Enterprise, Environment, External Relations, Financial Stability, Financial Services and Capital Markets Union , Fisheries and Aquaculture, Food Safety, Foreign and Security Policy and Defence, General and Institutional Affairs, Home Affairs, Humanitarian Aid, Information Society, Internal Market, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Public Health, Regional Policy, Research and Technology, Sport, Taxation, Trade, Trans-European Networks, Transport, Youth
